Company_Reputation:
Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile.

Department Summary

Our Customer Experience Operations (CXO) teams go above and beyond by simplifying lives and enhancing community access to our products and services. Behind the scenes, dedicated individuals focus on refining the experience for millions of customers across all of our brands and providing support to our field agents.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

We are looking for a data-driven Contact and Conversation Reporting Analyst Lead to join our Customer Experience Transformation team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, tracking, and reporting on customer interactions, including contact reasons, while examining conversations to uncover deeper insights into customer needs and their experiences with our care channels. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills and be able to provide actionable insights into the drivers behind customer contacts, helping to enhance the customer experience and optimize our care channels.

Key Responsibilities:
• Contact Reasons Reporting:
• Understand the reasons why customers contact our care channels
• Develop and maintain weekly reporting on contact reasons, highlighting any week over week changes
• Conversations Analysis and Insights:
• Leverage AI-based tools to analyze call recordings and chat transcripts to gain deeper insights into why the customer had to contact a live agent for support
• Investigate root cause of customer contact drivers
• Categorize insights to understand upstream and downstream opportunities for improvements
• Package insights and detailed analysis to tell the customer’s story to drive continuous improvement of customer experience
• Performance Improvement Initiatives:
• Share insights and findings with stakeholders to drive customer engagement and service delivery improvements
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams from operations and the business to share insights and gain support for improvement initiatives
• Trend Analysis:
• Analyze insights for seasonality and impact of business changes on contact drivers
• Work closely with the Voice of the Customer team to correlate conversation drivers and customer feedback

Skills, Experience and Requirements

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field
• 5+ years in a similar reporting or data analysis role, preferably within a wireless services or telecommunications environment

Skills and Qualifications:
• Proficiency with AI topic modeling
• Familiarity with Qualtrics XM platform
• Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide clear, actionable insights
• Strong written and verbal communication skills for reporting and collaborating with cross-functional team
• Proactive approach to identifying experience gaps and suggesting improvements
• Experience working in the wireless or telecom industry preferred
• Familiarity with CCaaS platforms preferred

Salary Ranges

Compensation: $72,350.00/Year - $103,400.00/Year
Benefits

We offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location.

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check. Our company is committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace where every individual has the opportunity to succeed. We are dedicated to providing individuals with criminal or arrest records a fair chance of employment in accordance with local, state, and federal laws.

The posting will be active for a minimum of 3 days. The active posting will continue to extend by 3 days until the position is filled.

Company_Reputation:
Who are we?
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.

We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, support local communities, and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help them realize their goals.

So, we created the leading small business loan platform. At the end of 2020, Investors had lent $15.2 billion in 143,000 loans to 100,000 small business owners globally. There’s never been a better time to join!

Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.

This role sits within the “Tech, Data, and Risk” teams. The drivers behind our platform – brilliant people working together to create, code, and build the next game changers.

What will you be doing?

Funding Circle Customer Analyst is a quantitative analyst who can extract meaningful business insights from customer data, and leverage predictive models to create decision strategies that will optimize business performance. The person will support the Marketing, Product, Risk, Capital Markets, Operations, and Finance teams.

This is a strategic role that sits at the heart of value creation, utilizing leading edge analytics and turning data into long term competitive advantages.
• Understands business needs and conduct analysis on customer data to facilitate problem-solving
• Recommends optimal business strategies based on historical performance, predictive analytics, and scenario analysis
• Understands customer motivations and develops actionable segmentation models
• Can find and apply the robust statistical techniques to improve A/B testing from test design to analyzing results. Comfortable working with limited data at times and using judgment
• Can identify the best modeling techniques (such as machine learning, regression, tree-based) to solve business problems and can partner with the tech team to implement these algorithms into production environments
• Effective in working with stakeholders outside of the team to identify hypotheses, structure analysis, recommend solutions, and communicate results
• Desire to learn from others and a desire to bring something new to the team so we can learn from you too!

Are you?
• Bachelor’s degree in Quantitative or Finance related field required, Masters/PhD preferred
• 2+ years of experience working with Analytics in Financial Services
• Proficient with analytical tools like Excel VBA, QlikView, Tableau, R or SAS, Python
• Proven problem-solving skills using logical reasoning and analytical methods
• Excellent ability to translate complex problems into clear and simple stories
• Open minded, collaborative, great to interact with
• Identification with our Mission, “To build a better financial world”
• Alignment with our Core Values: Think Smart, Make It Happen, Be Open, Stand Together, Live The Adventure

Why should you join us?

We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by tech.

That means full steam ahead working on our global platform and real challenges for you to noodle and solve – as we build new things, reimagine the stack and go after the greenfield.

We believe that great ideas come from everywhere. So, there are no pigeonholes here. We keep it agile and open. Think big remits and huge ownership in a continuous learning environment. Close knit teams, with mentorships and global career opportunities. Everyone working together to make a genuine difference to small business owners.

Join the team making it happen. Help us define long-term commitments and launch the next game changers – let’s build the incredible.

It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.

At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Want to Build the Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.
• Colorado Only* Base Salary of $100,000 to $112,000 + equity + benefits

Company_Reputation:
GitLab is an open core software company that develops the most comprehensive AI-powered DevSecOps Platform, used by more than 100,000 organizations. Our mission is to enable everyone to contribute to and co-create the software that powers our world. When everyone can contribute, consumers become contributors, significantly accelerating the rate of human progress. This mission is integral to our culture, influencing how we hire, build products, and lead our industry. We make this possible at GitLab by running our operations on our product and staying aligned with our values. Learn more about Life at GitLab.

An Overview Of This Team

The Customer Experience Strategy and Operations (CX) team at GitLab is focused on improving customer experiences across the end-to-end customer journey. As a Customer Experience Analyst at GitLab, you will be part of a global customer experience practice dedicated to listening and learning from our customers, harnessing the power of customer insights to drive and influence business improvements and bolster customer-centric decision-making across the business. You will play a pivotal role in driving customer satisfaction and loyalty by analyzing insights and feedback, identifying areas for improvement, and partnering with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies that enhance the overall customer experience. Leveraging your strong background in CX/VoC and expertise in data analysis and storytelling, your passion for customer centricity, you will help shape the future of our customer experience program and contribute to the growth and success of our organization.

What You'll Do
• Manage end-to-end analytics, reporting, and partnerships across multiple customer touchpoints including purchase and delivery journeys.
• Synthesize and analyze customer feedback from multiple sources (e.g., surveys, digital analytics, social media) and channels (e.g., direct to consumer, supply chain) to identify trends, pain points, and areas of improvement.
• Monitor customer feedback continuously to identify emerging trends and issues, performing deep dive analysis to uncover wins and opportunities.
• Champion the voice of customers by sharing insights widely and collaborating with relevant business partners to foster customer-centric decision-making.
• Develop and maintain robust reporting and dashboards to track customer experience metrics and KPIs.
• Integrate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral data sources to create a comprehensive picture of experience drivers.
• Advocate for customers and influence corrective actions through periodic and ad-hoc reporting, proactively evangelizing insights among key stakeholders.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify root causes of customer issues and develop action plans to remediate and measure effectiveness.
• Design and implement customer experience improvement initiatives that align with business objectives and priorities.
• Bring insights and recommendations to the forefront of stakeholders and executives’ mindshare via engaging presentations.

What You'll Bring
• 6+ years of experience in data analytics, including experience in customer feedback or survey analysis, statistical analysis, marketing analytics, data science, or related fields
• 3+ years of experience in customer experience or customer insights analytics
• Proficiency in crafting compelling stories using multiple sources of data to provide actionable insights tailored to stakeholders’ needs
• Experience creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
• Experience working with Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), surveys, and customer feedback
• Proven analytical skills working with large datasets and statistical analysis methods. Experience using SQL
• Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
• Experience with statistical analytics techniques and using R or Python or a similar scripting language/tool for analysis
• Demonstrated experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams
• Effective data-led storytelling with the experience conveying complex insights to non-technical stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications
• Degree in Analytics, Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer/Data Science, Engineering, Economics, or related field
• Experience working with customer experience platforms (e.g., Gainsight, Qualtrics)
• Background in digital or marketing analytics
• Background in ecommerce and direct to consumer business and analytics
• Familiarity with consumer electronics or retail business
• Knowledge of predictive analytics or ML/AI techniques is a plus
• Survey design and CX program management experience is a plus

How GitLab Will Support You
• Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being
• All remote, asynchronous work environment
• Flexible Paid Time Off
• Team Member Resource Groups
• Equity Compensation & Employee Stock Purchase Plan
• Growth and development budget
• Parental leave
• Home office support

Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application.

Remote-Global

The base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently for residents of listed locations only. Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. See more information on our benefits and equity. Sales roles are also eligible for incentive pay targeted at up to 100% of the offered base salary.

$84,000—$180,000 USD

Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.

Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us.

Company_Reputation:
Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills and talents to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.

Position Summary

Responsible for the strategic management of all primary marketing research initiatives and syndicated studies with internal and external resources in order to shape and improve business decision-making and execution for marketing and product development. Consult and collaborate with assigned internal stakeholders to understand their business in order to identify critical business objectives, design appropriate marketing research studies, validate analytics, synthesize findings, and present primary marketing research results and recommendations.

Understand the short and long-term strategy goals and objectives of Xcel Energy and the Marketing Research organization to fulfill associated marketing research needs and continue to grow best practices.

Essential

Responsibilities
• Consult and collaborate proactively with assigned internal stakeholder teams to understand their business needs and questions. Identify and propose potential marketing research initiatives that would inform their business questions through exposure to customer, market, and competitive trends.
• Partner with assigned stakeholder teams to ensure that they are utilizing research to inform their decision-making. Attend stakeholder staff meetings in order to remain informed about their initiatives and provide insights and suggest potential solutions to their challenges based on marketing research.
• Manage and drive the planning, implementation, and execution of all marketing research programs both primary and secondary for assigned stakeholder teams. Ensure successful project management throughout the research process from conception through final deliverables. Direct the generation of final deliverables in collaboration with external vendors and internal stakeholders that communicate insights and implications that are relevant to stakeholders. Effectively communicate milestone achievements or challenges with research stakeholders and encourage their involvement in the process in order to incorporate their input into the final outcomes of the research.
• Clearly define the research objectives and the necessary scope of the research. Identify timing and resource constraints for the research. Design, implement and manage research projects with various levels of complexity. Successfully partner and manage the activities of the external vendors in terms of the preferred methodology, sampling, survey instrument, analysis plan design, reporting and presentation. Ensure the work meets determined research objectives, within client timing and research constraints, subject to managerial review and approval.
• Implement special projects on behalf of the Marketing Research Organization to ensure that the department remains efficient and utilizes best practices throughout the project management process and to expand the impact of marketing research throughout Xcel Energy.
• Remains up-to-date on the offerings that external vendors provide and new methodologies being utilized to answer marketing research questions.
• Remains up-to-date on company, industry and business issues/trends to ensure clients are appropriately considered in the research process. Surfaces customer-related strategic issues and initiatives for client discussion.

Minimum Requirements For Sr. Communications Insight Analyst
• Required Bachelor's degree in a related field 5+ years experience in marketing research including both quantitative and qualitative methods
• Experience in one of the following areas: brand, advertising and communications research, DSM program evaluations, customer loyalty, Voice of the Customer/Customer Experience;
Custom/adhoc marketing research topics to inform business decision-making; syndicated research
• Proven written and verbal communication skills
• Approximately 10% travel required
Preferred

Requirements for Sr. Communications Insight Analyst:
• MBA
• 3+ years experience in the utilities/energy industry
• Brand, advertising and communications research experience

Minimum Requirements for Communications Insight Analyst:
• Required Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.
• 2 years experience in marketing research including both quantitative and qualitative methods
• Proven written and verbal communication skills
• Approximately 10% travel required
Preferred

Requirements For Communications Insight Analyst
• 1-2 years experience in the utilities/energy industry
• Brand, advertising and communications research experience
As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we…

Company_Reputation:
Let’s be unstoppable together!

Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data, and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. We understand more about the complete consumer, the complete store, and the complete wallet so our clients can go beyond the data to apply insights, ignite innovation, meet consumer demand, and outpace the competition.

At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. We have a global commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as we believe in the undeniable strength that diversity brings to our business, employees, clients, and communities (with us you can always bring your full self to work). Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at www.circana.com.

What will you be doing?

The CI Analyst III role will support a new Circana client in the Perimeter-Protein space as part of the dynamic, growing Fresh Foods practice. The Analyst will serve as the day-to-day Client Lead, advising and supporting all Circana data & insights efforts. Partnering with the Client Service Lead, the Analyst will ensure that the client secures maximum benefit of subscribed services and leads the client up the insights development curve. Further, the Analyst partner with all Circana Solution Leads (e.g., Analytics, Innovation, eComm) to leverage our massive toolkit to bolster the client’s Marketing/Sales/Insights programs to yield Sales growth. This role is a terrific pathway to quickly build subject matter expertise and forge internal and external networks to fuel career development…and have fun along the way! The Fresh Foods practice enjoys a 90%+ Share of Protein manufacturer clients and is the data-of-record for all Associations and Wall Street…so come and be a part of the industry leadership!

Job Responsibilities
• Program Management: Lead regimented client engagement via meetings, communications, calendars, project trackers, presentations, etc.
• Data Advisory: Learn the nuances of Fresh data and educate the client on data complexities and continuous innovation. Solid Unify+ skills are key for both POS and Panel. Work with Unify Success Manager to build, deploy, and continuously update best-in-class reports.
• Analytics Advisory: Embed best-in-class approaches/methodologies to diagnose the business and make recommendations across the 4P’s to drive growth. Continuously deliver insights packages via Unify+ and Excel/PPT deliverables…supplementing with industry thought leadership & qualitative insights.
• Solution Selling: Partner with dedicated internal Solution Leads to bring to bear the right solution(s) for the client’s business imperatives and burning questions to growth their business. This requires gaining Solution SME, active listening, network-building, and creativity.
• Client Advocate: Lead all Circana client support activities from an internal operational perspective—manage the P&L, keep Dynamics CRM updated, participate in all Fresh/Perimeter CI/CS updates and initiatives, etc.

Requirements
• 3+ years of Circana-oriented CPG syndicated market research experience
• Intermediate to Expert level SME with Unify+ and/or similar OLAP tools
• Demonstrated mastery 4P analytics to drive business growth recommendations through insights
• Strong communication skills—both written and verbal—to effectively and efficiently progress efforts forward
• Strong networking and teaming acumen given the myriad topics and Circana solutions
• A proactive “go-getter” who is excited to develop their career through effort and positivity

Circana Behaviors

As well as the technical skills, experience and attributes that are required for the role, our shared behaviors sit at the core of our organization. Therefore, we always look for people who can continuously champion these behaviors throughout the business within their day-to-day role:
• Stay Curious: Being hungry to learn and grow, always asking the big questions
• Seek Clarity: Embracing complexity to create clarity and inspire action
• Own the Outcome: Being accountable for decisions and taking ownership of our choices
• Center on the Client: Relentlessly adding value for our customers
• Be a Challenger: Never complacent, always striving for continuous improvement
• Champion Inclusivity: Fostering trust in relationships engaging with empathy, respect and integrity
• Commit to each other: Contributing to making Circana a great place to work for everyone

Location

This position can be located in the following area(s): 100% Remote with some potential travel to Chicago—HQ for both the client and Circana.

The below range reflects the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. An employee’s position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs.

The salary range for this role is $61,000 to $95,000.

skills_required: sql, go, data analysis, tableau, excel

Benefits: ['The expected compensation for this role is an annual salary range of $50,000 - $75,000', 'The final compensation will be determined after evaluating a candidate’s experience, skills, etc']
Company_Reputation:
We’re Antenna, a data and analytics startup that aims to expand knowledge of subscriber behavior so brands can entertain, inspire, and empower the world. We provide industry and competitive benchmarks across key metrics so our customers can know ‘what good looks like’, market intelligence so they can learn how to build a best-in-class business, and insights to inform their strategic decisions making. Antenna is the market standard for subscription analytics.

We’re looking for an Insight Analyst to drive the understanding and engagement with Antenna data by delivering best-in-class insights. In this role, you are closely partnering with Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing and your role will be to transform our data into useful, actionable insights. You will interface directly with our customers on the one hand and our internal product and commercial teams on the other. As an Insight Analyst, you will report into the VP of Operations. Antenna is remote-first and welcomes applicants from anywhere in the United States.

What You’ll Do
• Showcase the advanced use cases of Antenna data and subscriber metrics by creating relevant, actionable insights. To do this, you will need to:
• Be an expert in Antenna metrics and why it matters to the Subscription economy
• Conduct in-depth data analysis to deliver relevant, timely, meaningful insights to customers and internal stakeholders
• Use our proprietary interface to analyze subscribers by key cohorts such as service, distributor, plan, user cohort, etc.
• Create effective and clear visualizations and dashboards to tell powerful stories with the data
• Work closely with Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing teams to deliver custom insights
• Proactively stay on top of subscription trends, relevant events, emerging platforms, and other inputs that would drive interesting analyses

Who You Are
• 2-3 years of experience in using data analytics to drive business decisions and strategies
• Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint. Bonus: Has some knowledge of SQL.
• Experience analyzing and organizing large amounts of information with great attention to detail and accuracy
• Able to present insights in a clear and compelling way via custom visualizations and dashboards
• Strong communication skills with the ability to transform data into narratives that are easy to understand for different audiences and various stakeholders, both verbally and in writing
• A self-starter who thrives in rapidly changing environments where priorities shift often
• Bonus: A strategic thinker who is interested in the subscription economy and how data can help inform customer decision-making
• Bonus: Experience in using business intelligence tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Looker, Tableau, etc.)

Compensation:

The expected compensation for this role is an annual salary range of $50,000 - $75,000. The final compensation will be determined after evaluating a candidate’s experience, skills, etc.

About Antenna

Antenna is the leading provider of data and analytics for the U.S. Subscription Economy. Our standardized metrics, competitive benchmarks, syndicated insights, and market intelligence are used by some of the most trusted brands across media and entertainment sectors to better understand subscriber behavior and successfully navigate the rapidly changing consumer subscription landscape.

Founded in 2019 by Jonathan Carson, a successful serial entrepreneur with deep roots in data and analytics, and Rameez Tase, a seasoned executive in media and analytics, Antenna’s mission is supported by top investors with global expertise in media and technology: Raine Ventures, BDMI, UTA Ventures, and many more. Antenna is powered by a dedicated group of individuals who are intellectually curious, passionate about service, and committed to supporting the needs of Antenna clients and each other every day. As a small remote-first team, Antenna team members have the opportunity to work alongside senior leaders and professionally grow with an early-stage team.

https://www.antenna.live/

Company_Reputation:
Why Wells Fargo:

This is where your true career begins. We ranked #2 on the 2023 LinkedIn Top Companies list – and #1 among financial services companies – as the best workplace “to grow your career” in the U.S. At Wells Fargo, we support employees’ career aspirations and growth. We’re proud of our employee-welfare-centered business approach and our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.

We offer competitive salaries and one of the richest benefits packages in the industry. Our Total Rewards program focuses on wellness, work-life balance and the financial health of our employees. Our customers invest with us, we invest in you. Apply today.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Data Management Analyst within Customer Excellence Data and Analytics (CEDA). Our organization, Customer Excellence Data and Analytics (CEDA), sits within Enterprise Complaints and Remediations (ECR) and focuses on being Wells Fargo’s leading data and analytics organization in solving business problems, finding actionable insights, proactively mitigating risk, and enabling operational excellence. CEDA supports the Wells Fargo enterprise with business enablement and analytics that solve problems, drive efficiency and sustain a strong risk and control environment. We use our expansive knowledge of data to operationalize analytic solutions.

Within CEDA, this role will be a part of Strategy, Transformation and Automated Controls (STAC) which leads CEDAs strategic priorities, data as a “product,” and transformation office supporting all analytical functions within CEDA. STAC leads analytics development and business strategies focused on contact center operational efficiencies, quality controls, and risk mitigation in near-real time for enhanced customer and team member experiences. We use unique skills and consultative skillsets to support CEDAs strategic objectives, employee services, and product management through agile transformation. Our mission is to scale the program which allows for consistent process, risk, and control frameworks that offer people + data solutions that bring about more accurate and efficient risk coverage. These solutions enhance risk coverage with the goal of 100% risk detection along with 100% correction capabilities for the frontline.

In this role, you will:
• Develop routine and rigor to ensure delivery of policy compliant automated solutions that adhere to all enterprise policies (i.e. Solution Delivery, Issue Management, Change Management, etc.).
• Lead cross functional teams to strategize, plan, and execute a variety of programs, services and initiatives using applications such as Power Apps
• Ensure efficiency, quality, cost effectiveness of solutions, and pipeline management relating to assigned operations
• Research moderately complex business, operational, and strategic initiatives that require analytical skills, basic knowledge of organizational strategy and Business Execution, and understanding of international business
• Work independently or within a team to make recommendations for system functions by providing support and leadership
• Assist in the planning and execution of a variety of programs and initiatives that may include risk mitigation, efficiency, and customer experience
• Collaborate and consult with team leaders in developing project plans, policies and procedures
• Provide leadership in management of relationships and implementation of programs, services, and initiatives with cross functional business partners
• Lead project teams and mentor less experienced staff members

Required Qualifications:
• 5+ years of Data Management, Business Analysis, Analytics, or Project Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
• 4+ years of experience with analytical and Microsoft Power Platform tools (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Query and Power BI, Tableau)

Desired Qualifications:
• Power Apps development expertise
• Knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Alteryx, SQL, and Power BI for analysis, reporting, visualization, and data driven testing purposes
• Review and identify areas for improvement leading to operational efficiency, process optimization, and field acceleration working with various teams within the organization (operations, IT, leadership, etc.)
• Reporting - Dashboard and Scorecard, MBR, business analysis
• Proven experience and track record in creating and executing strategic programs and working in strategic consulting teams.
• Good expertise on Data management, Excel / MIS / Reporting Tools / Power Point.
• Experience designing and maintaining Confluence templates, JIRA boards, and sprint execution
• Ability to identify, research and solution simple to complex business, technology and reporting requirements
• Experience with contact center data and exploratory data evaluation (finding data and data extraction)

Pay Range

Reflected is the base pay range offered for this position. Pay may vary depending on factors including but not limited to achievements, skills, experience, or work location. The range listed is just one component of the compensation package offered to candidates.
$100,000.00 - $237,100.00

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit’s risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Company Profile

At Sand Cherry Associates, we excel in the design and delivery of strategic customer-centric initiatives through digitally-native, data-empowered solutions. Our client’s confidence in us is centered on exceptionally skilled, high-energy talent working with the support of the full Sand Cherry team. Finding the right match for this role is a critical aspect of continuing that success.

Overview

We are looking for a Senior Web Analyst who will lead the charge for defining the customer analytics strategy and execution across customer facing channels, both online and offline amid a broad digital transformation. Successful candidates will ensure that web and customer data is being captured accurately, governed to preserve integrity, and then reported with actionable insights. This role involves collaborating cross functionally through business unit, sales, digital marketing, digital analytics, digital design, IT, and CRM professionals. that will grow consumer direct / omnichannel capabilities. This is a hybrid position. All qualified candidates MUST reside in the Denver, CO area and be authorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship or C2C.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Engage collaboratively with key stakeholders to identify and prioritize customer analytics needs across different data sources (web, point of sale, 3rd party data etc)
• If the data is available and accurate, deliver insightful, compelling, and actionable reports, dashboard to address these needs with a high sense of urgency
• If the data is not available (or not accurate), work with the IT team and create a roadmap and implementation plan to collect this data in a scalable manner
• Move the larger organization to a data driven decision making leveraging the deep customer insights from the data
• Identify growth opportunities by analyzing user behavior, navigation patterns, page performance and conversion funnels
• Establish dashboard and reporting standards for entire Advanced Energy team focused on KPIs (sales, traffic, conversion, etc.)
• Manage strategic direction of all site tagging
• Partner with Development and QA teams to ensure accuracy and quality
• Provide data-driven insights to increase overall site conversion, improve performance and customer experience
• Educate teams in web analytics and create a self-service analytics reporting culture
• Play a pivotal role in the site A/B testing strategy and subsequent analysis
• Communicate to both peers and executive leadership opportunities for site improvements and customer insights
• Collaboratively guide external vendors in regards to tracking, implementation, and reporting of analytics
• Stay abreast of new developments/strategies in analytics and competitor and industry trends

QUALIFICATIONS:
• 3+ years of relevant web and customer analytics experience
• Knowledge of GA 4 (Google analytics 4) tagging and implementation is required. Experience with Google Analytics Tag manager (GTM) is preferred
• Strong Power BI skills
• Experience with B2B (preferred) or B2C customer analytics with the ability to communicate complex concepts to a variety of audiences including those who do not have a technical/Digital/eCommerce background
• Problem solving mindset with experience diagnosing, reporting, tracking and resolving data quality issues
• Strong analytic, quantitative, and data interpretation skills, ability to transform data into actionable insights
• Knowledge of digital marketing initiatives is preferred (Paid Search, SEO, Affiliates, Display) and a strong understanding of marketing channels.
• Proficient in Excel. SQL and Business Intelligence tools knowledge a plus.
• Basic familiarity with HTML, CSS and Javascript are a plus
• Self-motivated individual with ability to handle multiple high priority demands
• Adept at working within a heavily matrixed environment. Ability to guide, influence and navigate effectively with different constituencies in achieving goals
• Strong interpersonal skills. Must be influential, but able to work effectively in a matrixed project team which include a large 3rd party presence
• Smart and sound judgement to lead through changing and ambiguous environments
• Bachelor's Degree preferred

Compensation

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Sand Cherry Associates is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. This is a contract engagement with an annual salary of $120k-$135k. This position has the potential to be converted to a permanent role within the company after a 6-month contract. Years of experience, level of education, geographic location, unique skills/qualifications for the specific role and potential certifications can be key factors in the final compensation for this role.

Our team is unique — we are passionate about what we do. At Sand Cherry, our consultants know they are impacting and shaping our clients’ industries. We recognize our employees for their contributions. Our culture is one of the most friendly and communicative in the consulting industry. Sand Cherry is not a top-heavy organization. We offer the opportunity to be part of a digital workforce. Discover the experience that only comes with self-responsibility in the workplace. Our team members manage their own workloads and are expected to deliver exceptional work for our clients. Professional career growth is one of our main priorities, as we affirm that investing in our consultants and empowering our people will also deliver the best results and value for our clients.

Company_Reputation:
Xanterra Travel is hiring a Data Analyst, Customer with 3 - 5 years of experience. Based in United States - Greenwood Village, CO and with In-office ways of working.

Job description and responsibilities:

We are currently seeking a creative, thoughtful analytics professional to join our team. As Windstar Cruises’ Customer Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in managing and analyzing customer and travel agent data, optimizing marketing strategies, and enhancing the overall consumer experience. Working closely with marketing, sales, and IT teams, you will utilize your data-driven insights to drive consumer engagement, loyalty, and revenue growth. This position has the ability to be based out of our offices in either Greenwood Village, CO or Doral, FL.

Responsibilities
• Customer Database Management:
• Oversee the collection, integration, and maintenance of customer and travel agent data from various sources (e.g. reservation systems, website, external lists, etc.) into the marketing data platform.
• Ensure data accuracy, hygiene, and integrity to provide a reliable foundation for analysis and marketing campaigns.
• Continuously assess and enhance the data structure to align with Windstar Cruises and Xanterra Travel Collection business needs and customer segmentation strategies.
• Customer Data Analysis:
• Utilize advanced analytics tools and techniques to analyze customer, prospect, and travel agent data to identify trends, behaviors, and preferences.
• Derive actionable insights from data analysis to inform marketing and sales strategies, personalized messaging, and targeted campaigns.
• Measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and provide recommendations for optimization.
• Segmentation Strategy:
• Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and refine customer segmentation strategies.
• Create and manage customer segments based on demographic, behavioral, and transactional data to tailor marketing efforts and enhance customer experiences.
• Reporting and Visualization:
• Maintain existing and develop new standardized reports and dashboards to provide stakeholders with regular updates on customer engagement, campaign performance, and other key metrics.
• Utilize data visualization tools to present complex data in a clear and compelling manner to facilitate decision-making.
• Campaign Optimization:
• assessing the marketing team to design A/B tests and conduct post-campaign analysis to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
• Provide insights and recommendations for improving campaign performance and increasing ROI.
• System Support:
• Collaborate with IT and vendors to troubleshoot system issues and ensure seamless data flow and system upgrades as it relates to Sales and Marketing.
• Document business rules, segmentation strategies, and workflows to facilitate system maintenance and knowledge sharing.
• Customer Journey Mapping:
• Analyze the customer and travel agent journey to identify pain points and opportunities for enhancing the overall experience.
• Collaborate with the marketing, sales, and guest service teams to develop strategies to improve customer satisfaction and retention.

Requirements and qualifications:

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in marketing, statistics, business, or a related field.
• Proven experience 3 years as a customer data analyst or a similar role in the travel or hospitality industry.
• Strong proficiency in database management and SQL querying.
• Experience working with CDP, customer data systems and related tools (e.g., RedPoint, Salesforce, etc.).
• Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and/or Google Data Studio.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data to non-technical stakeholders.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Interview_Process_Info: • Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data to non-technical stakeholders.

Company_Reputation:
Customer Data Analyst

- (2400252)

Candidates residing in the state of OH are preferred at this time.

Founded in 1934, Medical Mutual is the oldest and one of the largest health insurance companies based in Ohio. We provide peace of mind to more than 1.6 million Ohioans through our high-quality health, life, disability, dental, vision and indemnity plans. We offer fully insured and self-funded group coverage, including stop loss, as well as Medicare Advantage, Medicare Supplement and individual plans.

Medical Mutual’ s status as a mutual company means we are owned by our policyholders, not stockholders, so we don’t answer to Wall Street analysts or pay dividends to investors. Instead, we focus on developing products and services that allow us to better serve our customers and the communities around us and help our members achieve their best possible health and quality of life.

Under moderate to limited supervision, conducts routine to moderately complex quantitative analysis supporting strategic business decisions. Focuses on measuring and analyzing customer behaviors across channels and interactions. Primarily works indirectly with internal business customers.

Responsibilities

Customer Data Analyst II
• Identifies, recommends and implements analytics strategy and approach including routine to moderately complex processes and analyses to deliver meaningful and actionable results as it relates to customer behavior, feedback, operational metrics and segmentation.
• Combines data from the customer data warehouse, operational systems, and channel specific reporting systems to deliver actionable insights.
• Publishes and communicates results, ensuring timely and accurate reports are delivered to business partners.Develops dashboards and presentations which include solutions to known problems. Responds and follows up on questions from business partners.
• Delivers cross-channel metrics and identifies customer trends.
• Performs ad-hoc reporting requests as needed.

Customer Data Analyst III
• Implements analytics strategy and approach, including routine to complex and/or varied processes and analyses to deliver meaningful and actionable results as it relates to customer behavior, feedback and operational metrics and segmentation.
• Collaborates with business partners to identify issues and develop statistically valid and methodologically sound approaches to address business needs.
• Publishes and communicates results, ensuring timely and accurate insights are delivered to business partners. Develops dashboards and presentations which include solutions to known problems. Responds and follows up on questions from business partners.
• Orients, trains and assists more junior level staff.
• Performs ad-hoc reporting requests as needed.

Sr. Customer Data Analyst
• Implements analytics strategy and approach, including complex and/or varied processes and analyses to deliver meaningful and actionable results as it relates to customer behavior, feedback, operational metrics and segmentation
• Collaborates with business partners to identify issues and develops and implements statistically valid and methodologically sound approaches to address business needs
• Publishes and communicates results, ensuring timely and accurate reports are delivered to the business partners
• Provides reporting and analytics to support business processes, including accessing data structures and using analytical tools
• Delivers cross-channel metrics which identify customer trends and cross business feedback
• Orients, trains and assists and may review work of more junior level staff.
• May provide project specific indirect leadership to other analysts within the customer experience department.
• Provides limited or indirect supervision or leadership responsibility over a group.
• Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Customer Data Analyst II

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Social Sciences or related field.
• 2 years of experience as a Customer Data Analyst or equivalent experience in data or business analytics, preferably in a health insurance environment.

Technical Skills and Knowledge:
• Knowledge of customer analytics and/or Relationship Management theory and practice.
• Intermediate proficiency in SAS, SPSS, SQL and other analytical tools.
• Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (word processing, spreadsheets, database reporting, presentation graphics) and other related applications such as Tableau.
• Good presentation skills; ability to put together decks and dashboards displaying results.

Customer Data Analyst III

Education and Experience:
• Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Economics, Social Sciences or related field.
• 3 years experience as a Customer Data Analyst or equivalent experience in data or business analytics, preferably in a health insurance environment.

Technical Skills and Knowledge:
• Strong knowledge of Customer Analytics and/or Relationship Management theory and practice.
• Strong proficiency in SAS, SPSS, SQL and other analytical tools including Tableau.
• Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills (word processing, spreadsheets, database reporting, presentation graphics) and other related applications such as Tableau.
• Strong presentation skills; ability to put together decks and dashboards displaying results.

Sr. Customer Data Analyst

Education and Experience:
• Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Economics, Social Sciences or related field.
• Master's Degree preferred.
• 5 years progressive experience as a Customer Data Analyst or equivalent experience in data or business analytics, preferably in a health insurance environment.

Technical Skills and Knowledge:
• Comprehensive knowledge of Customer Analytics and/or Relationship Management theory and practice.
• Advanced proficiency in SAS, SPSS and other analytical tools including Tableau.
• Advanced Microsoft Office skills (word processing, spreadsheets, database reporting, presentation graphics) and other related applications such as Tableau.
• Ability to work with Customer Experience leaders and leaders in other areas to deliver meaningful insights.

Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile.

Department Summary

Our Customer Experience Operations (CXO) teams go above and beyond by simplifying lives and enhancing community access to our products and services. Behind the scenes, dedicated individuals focus on refining the experience for millions of customers across all of our brands and providing support to our field agents.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

Our Wireless Escalations team acts as business managers for the entire agent ticketing system--providing ticketing insights to improve the agent and customer experience. The team lives at the junction of meeting the needs of a variety of business partners, coordinating execution with internal teams and ensuring our front-line teams have the resources to be successful while interacting with our customers.

Company_Reputation:
Title: Insight Manager

Level/Salary Range: $92,500 - $113,000

Position Type: Full-time

Who We Are:

Who we are begins with what we believe, and we believe better products lead to better lives. We are consumer, brand and strategy experts that help innovators see how to build better. mindsight is Vision Revealed.

What You Will Do:

The Insight Manager plays an active and leadership role in the execution and reporting of primary quantitative research efforts for mindsight clients. In addition to the end-to-end execution of primary quantitative research, the Insight Manager also plays a key role in the training and development of other mindsighters. the Insight Manager has roles and responsibilities that include [but may not be limited to]:

INSIGHT EXECUTION | APPLICATION
• Lead the quantitative research project(s), including questionnaire design, sampling plan, analytic plan, report design and report analysis
• Execute questionnaire creation, revisions and finalization, ensuring that client research objectives will be met
• Work with insight analysts, associate(s), operations partners to ensure proper study programming, quality control and fieldwork, and data delivery
• Conduct analysis and complete research summaries, ensuring strategic insight(s) are both clearly communicated and delivered as requested
• Present and/or communicate research results to various audiences, including client senior management
• Work with insight analysts and associates to support the execution of Floodlight projects, ensuring client objectives are met
• Develop understanding of client categories, brands, and business dynamics and utilize that understanding to craft thoughtful deliverables and deliver an excellent client experience

PROJECT MANAGEMENT
• Manage and coordinate multiple research projects and timelines so as to deliver on time and in accordance with client request(s)
• Demonstrate strong attention to detail and execute work with a high degree of accuracy and precision
• Communicate frequently and effectively both with internal and external stakeholders; set clear expectations and follow up appropriately and in a timely manner

MENTORSHIP AND LEADERSHIP
• Contribute to the development of the mindsightorganization through enhancing company capabilities and helping associate managers and analysts to learn
• Review insight analysts and associates project work (e.g. questionnaires, sampling plans, reports etc.) to ensure both client objectives are being met, but also provide thoughtful feedback to help other mindsighters learn and grow

ORGANIZATIONAL DEVELOPMENT
• Act as the voice of the customer, proactively sharing the feedback received in the course of managing client relationships to inform product enhancements and innovation
• Use your functional knowledge and influence to create efficiencies within projects (forecast issues or roadblocks, ask clarifying questions, etc.)
• Support the development of company culture, processes, and best practices
• Operate with integrity in all aspects of business relationships, internally and externally

Who You Are:

Qualifications:
• Demonstrated ability to and interest in working in a fast-paced environment, effectively managing multiple projects at once, strong multi-tasking capabilities.
• 3+ years primary market research or related experience.
• 2-3 years developing quantitative research surveys, including, but not limited to, Concept Tests, Product tests, Variety sorts, Attitude & Usage and Equity Trackers and other custom research studies.
• Well-developed understanding of research techniques used to assess concepts/products/programs, identify targets, and monitor business performance are all required.
• Experience mentoring, training and/or managing other researchers, preferred but not required
• Demonstrated ability to use quantitative research tools and techniques to answer key research questions and address business objectives.
• Excellent creative and analytic problem-solving-skills; analyzes situations to think of new solutions and make recommendations.
• Detailed understanding of quantitative market research methodologies, sampling practices, analytical tools (statistical testing), and best practices.
• Demonstrated ability to interpret results and draw conclusions from analyses; troubleshoot errors in data and interpretation.

Company_Reputation:
Flex is a growth-stage, NYC headquartered FinTech company that is creating the best rent payment experience. It’s hard to believe that it’s 2024 and paying rent on time is expensive, inflexible, and difficult. We’re here to change that! Flex enables our users to pay rent throughout the month on a schedule that better fits their finances and budget. Our mission is to empower as many renters as possible with flexibility over their most significant recurring expense. After deliberately keeping a stealth profile as we built up unprecedented investor support and an enthusiastic user base, we are looking for motivated individuals to help us keep our mission growing. Will you be a part of the team?

About the role

As a Principal Data Analyst, reporting to our Head of Analytics, you will play a key role in helping shape Flex’s future by supporting key analytics projects across our Customer Support, Finance, Go-To-Market, Marketing, Product, and Strategy teams. You will help navigate some of the most challenging problems across the Flex business, bringing data-driven insights and clarity to ambiguous problems. The ideal candidate for this role is intensely curious, holds themselves to a high analytical bar, while simultaneously balancing analytical rigor with speed and ultimate business impact.

What you’ll do
• Proactively explore data across multiple Flex domains to identify relationships and trends that will inform the future direction of the business
• Create and improve dashboards, visualizations, and automations that help us scale analytics across Flex
• Partner with functional area leaders across the business to uncover insights and opportunities, as well as root causing drivers of performance
• Working closely with the rest of Analytics and Business Intelligence to improve our source of truth across both internal and client-facing data
• Combine data and strategy - being that bridge between what the data is telling us and the implications for strategic priorities within different areas of the business

Key qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree with a quantitative focus (Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.)
• 6+ years of experience using analytical and statistical methods to support and drive critical business outcomes
• Effective communicator who can break down complex technical concepts into simple business vernacular
• Demonstrated success supporting and influencing business strategy across from an analytics perspective
• Advanced experience with SQL, business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Mode, Looker, etc.)
• Experience with ETL processes, especially utilizing dbt and Snowflake
• Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data analysis and driving decision making
• Biased for action - doesn’t let perfect be the enemy of good enough, willing to build a first prototype and improve based on learnings, etc.
• Have a natural curiosity to dive into the details and have a strong analytical mindset

The salary compensation range for this role will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and Flex's internal leveling guidelines and benchmarks.
• For working locations in NY/NJ/CA, the base salary pay range will be $170,000-$186,000
• For all other states, the base salary pay range will be $153,000-$167,000

#LI-Remote

Life at Flex:

We understand that it takes a diverse team of highly intelligent, curious, determined, empathetic, and self aware people to grow a successful company. Our HQ is located in New York City, but we have employees located throughout the US, Australia, Canada and South America. We are growing quickly, but deliberately, with a focus on building an inclusive culture. Our dynamic team has incredible perspectives to share, just as we know you do, and we take great pride in being an equal opportunity workplace.

We offer many employee benefits. For full time, U.S. based employees we offer:
• Competitive pay
• 100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision
• 401(k) + company stock options
• Unlimited paid time off with a PTO minimum + 13 company paid holidays
• Parental leave
• Flex Cares Program: Non-profit company match + pet adoption coverage
• Free Flex subscription

Company_Reputation:
Company Overview

Techint Labs is a relationship-driven, independent advertising agency specializing in media, analytics, and design. We are a team of passionate strategists, creators, and innovators who take brands to new heights. We love what we do and thrive on exceeding expectations for our clients and partners.

We believe that our team is our greatest asset, and our focus on company culture has led to being recognized as a “Best Workplace” across Inc. Magazine (2017, 2018), Denver Business Journal (2018), and Built In Colorado (2018-2022).

Let’s push boundaries, together.

Summary of Role:

The Data Analyst plays a vital role in building a strong data foundation for our agency’s diverse client portfolio. As part of the Media & Analytics team, this position focuses on the collection, analysis, and reporting of data to deliver actionable insights that fuel real business results. Leveraging platforms like Google Analytics, advertising tools, and visualization software such as Looker Studio and Tableau, the Data Analyst will uncover key trends, identify growth opportunities, and provide strategic recommendations for campaign optimization. Experience in advertising/ marketing and a expert proficiency in GA4 are a must! Success in this role requires a combination of strong analytical, technical, and communication skills to effectively convey insights to both internal teams and external clients. Additionally, the role involves maintaining data workflows and creating detailed reports and dashboards. If you are driven by curiosity and passionate about uncovering the "why" behind the numbers, this is a dynamic opportunity to make a meaningful impact through data-driven marketing.

Responsibilities:
• Acquire relevant data from Google Analytics, advertising platforms, and other sources to answer business questions
• Perform analyses and uncover insights that connect to real business outcomes
• Advise Operations team on trends or opportunities seen in the data that can inform campaign optimizations
• Support the Media team with budget planning and revenue/lead forecasting
• Document analysis results and communicate findings clearly and succinctly in written and graphical form
• Present findings to both internal and external (client) stakeholders
• Maintain the data and reporting workflow for clients within our ETL tool and data visualization platforms
• Build reports and dashboards in Google Data Studio, Tableau, etc.

Location Information:

This role is required to be located near our Denver, CO office, with hybrid work from home flexibility.

Team members must live and work in the United States* (*territories excluded), and have access to reliable, high-speed internet.

Compensation:

Annual salary: $62,000 - $75,000 based on experience, with additional earning potential based on goal attainment and overall revenue impact.

Benefits:

Techint Labs offers full-time employees:
• Paid vacation, holidays, and sick days
• Health/dental/vision benefits
• 401k retirement plan and company match contribution
• Generous paid parental leave
• Wellness Program
• Denver, CO headquarters available for hybrid work with in office perks

Other Requirements:

Currently legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Equal Opportunity:

Techint Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, citizenship, age, Veteran status, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Important: Security Notice:

We're excited that you're interested in exploring job opportunities with Techint Labs! However, we also want to remind you to be cautious and wary of recruitment scams that have become increasingly common across all industries.

Fraudsters may pose as a representative of a company, and unsuspecting applicants may be invited to participate in fake interviews, asked to fill out fabricated employment applications, or even issued fake offer letters. This is all in an attempt to entice victims to pay money or divulge sensitive personal information.

We take your safety and privacy seriously, and want to assure you that we will never ask for your financial information during any part of the interview process.

Our communication will always come from an @careers.techintlabs.com or @techintlabs.com domain.

If you receive any suspicious activity, please stop communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center.
• ** Please do not send resumes via email ***

Additional Notices:

E-Verify Statement

AdCellerant participates in the E-Verify program for all new hires. We comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding employment eligibility verification and do not use E-Verify to pre-screen applicants.

Colorado Job Application Fairness Act

﻿Colorado Residents: In any materials you submit in connection with your job application, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. Should you wish to exercise your right to redact such information, please redact it prior to submitting the documentation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

Application Deadline:

Monday, November 18, 2024

Requirements

Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Management or related field
• 2-4 years experience in marketing, advertising, analytics or other relevant business experience
• Experience with Google Analytics 4
• Strong conceptual, analytical, and critical thinking skills, including the ability to analyze complex data sets that include interrelationships and dependencies to identify common themes and opportunities
• Intrinsic curiosity to find out "why" things are the way they appear to be
• Spreadsheet pro: you are the person others in the office ask for help
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Working knowledge of Google Analytics (Google Ads and Facebook Ads are a plus)
• Working knowledge of Google Data Studio or other visualization tools

Preferred Skills
• Experience with statistical tests and predictive analytics

• Experience with Tableau

Company_Reputation:
Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile.

Department Summary

Surpassing network limitations of the past, our Wireless Development organization is building the country’s first cloud-native, standalone 5G wireless network. This is the foundation of a connected world flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and transformative needs of today and the future.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

This role is part of the Network Data & Analytics (ND&A) team within the Network Development organization. ND&A is a Wireless Data Analytics and Science team aimed at optimizing Network Quality. Situated as the intelligence layer between data owners and consumers, it interprets end-to-end data from Network, Finance, and other sources to drive innovative correlations for business resolutions. These insights are crucial for optimizing resources in network build, operations, and enhancement. The ND&A team, comprising data scientists, engineers, and analysts, is dedicated to delivering the best Wireless experience for Subscribers and Enterprises.

Key Responsibilities:
• Analyze large datasets from telecom operations, customer behavior, and market trends using advanced analytics techniques
• Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms for customer segmentation, churn prediction, revenue forecasting, and operational efficiency
• Work with marketing, product management, and IT teams to identify opportunities and solve complex business problems
• Design and implement solutions to improve network performance, customer experience, and service delivery
• Interpret and present findings to stakeholders through data visualizations, reports, and presentations
• Maintain and enhance data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data quality, reliability, and accessibility
• Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in data science and telecom technologies

Skills, Experience and Requirements

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field
• 5+ years of experience with SQL and database skills in Teradata, AWS, and/or SQL Server databases
• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, Data Analyst, or similar role in the telecom industry

Skills and Qualifications:
• Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling techniques
• Experience with end-to-end ML-Ops model building and deployment in a cloud based environment, preferably AWS services such as SageMaker, Bedrock, EMR, S3, Lambda, and EC2
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and SQL, SnowFlake for data manipulation and analysis
• Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) for scalable data processing
• Proficiency in the use of modern data architectures and cloud services as well as NoSQL services like MongoDB, DynamoDB, etc.
• Ability to work with structured and unstructured datasets, and apply data mining techniques to extract valuable insights
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders

Salary Ranges

Compensation: $83,160.00/Year - $120,000.00/Year

We offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check.

The posting will be active for a minimum of 3 days. The active posting will continue to extend by 3 days until the position is filled.

Company_Reputation:
Collaboration drives Nordson's success as a market leader in Industrial Precision Solutions and Advanced Technology. Our employees thrive in an environment where we help each other reach our personal best and enable our company to continuously improve and grow, and our customers to succeed. You will find Nordson employees sharing our success by giving back in the communities around the world where we live and work.
Nordson MEDICAL designs, engineers and manufactures complex devices and components with applications in wound healing, surgical and minimally invasive, fluid management, pulmonology and interventional and structural heart. Our pioneering Advanced Polymers team was the first to manufacture and supply medical balloons to the medical device industry. Nordson MEDICAL works with doctors, start-ups and large medical companies around the world at any point in the product lifecycle, from concept to launch and beyond.
Job Summary
The Supply Chain Data Analyst is a strategic role responsible for driving data-driven decision-making within the supply chain function. The Analyst will gather, clean, organize, validate, analyze & present large amounts of data for the purpose of optimizing supply chain performance in support of strategic and tactical objectives. This position will also serve as the conduit between the business and IT, focusing on developing, validating and deploying supply chain related reports, tools and process improvements.
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities
Data Analyst
Compile data, manage databases, ensure data integrity, build reports, and drive continuous improvement of information metrics & data reporting. Mastery of complex data analytics.
Develops data visualization tools to support key Supply Chain metrics
Perform analytics on inventory data patterns and trends to determine how to best resolve constraints and to balance service, inventory and cost. Works with the local site Procurement team on Kanban, component pull and "Plan for Every Part" by providing data and tools to support.
Perform analytics on supply chain costs such as PPV, savings, inflation & forecasts, working closely with Finance partner and site supply chain teams to make decisions on standard costs.
Work closely with the Commodity Leaders & Supplier Management to provide required metrics, scorecards and analytics.
Identifies & implements areas to increase efficiency and automation of data analysis processes.
Provide ad-hoc reporting for Supply Chain team on an as-needed basis.
Serve as the Supply Chain business process subject matter expert and is liaison between IT team and user community.
Works to standardize and implement new business process solutions in the ERP & drives continuous improvement efforts
Audits the master data needed to support Supply Chain, works with the sites to update & maintain
Supports new site integrations, training and coaches' others with less experience
The ideal candidate will be able to work individually as well as in teams and is able flex their hours to support team members in Israel, Ireland, USA & Mexico. Preference is given to candidates that can commute to sites in Loveland CO, Eagan MN, Easton PA or Salem MA.
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations, Business, Finance, Industrial Engineering or related field.
In lieu of degree, consideration for up to 4 years of additional related experience may be considered.
5+ years related experience. Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market . Able to manage and analyze complex data translate business requirements into application requirements.
Skills and Abilities Ability to clean and interpret large sets of data
Data modeling, predictive modeling
Advanced statistical analysis
ERP/MRP experience in a manufacturing environment (preferably Procurement focus)
PowerBi, SQL
Working Conditions and Physical Demands
Office and manufacturing environment. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Travel Required
Minimal
Base Salary Range for this position is: $95,000 to $115,000, and bonus target is 3%; shift premium may be available depending on shift associated with the specific job opportunity. Benefits including Medical, Rx, Vision, Dental, and Health Savings Account (HSA), Retirement and Security benefits including 401k and Life Insurance.
